page.title: 07STOURBRIDGE TRANSPORT
page.content: The residents of Stourbridge are the proud owners of the shortest public ailway track in the whole of Britain.it is known as the "Shuttle"and runs for an average time of 3mins. 7secs.The track lies between Stourbridge Town Centre and the railway station,Stourbridge Junction. The bus service has been in existence since 1663,the days of the horseless carriage.Today the buses are more smoothly run, but there are occasional adventures as one interviewed driver recalls.He tells the story of a baby who was born on his bus! Stourbridge has a controversial ring road system.It had it's critics when it opened at 2 am.on the 13/11/68,and still has today.A 1985 survey shows that over 50%think it a "death trap."
